const { createClient } = require('@supabase/supabase-js');
const supabase = createClient(process.env.SUPABASE_URL, process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY);

async function findAccessibleUserSpecificTables() {
  try {
    console.log('ğŸ” FINDING ACCESSIBLE USER-SPECIFIC PATTERN TABLES');
    console.log('==================================================');
    
    // Test known accessible tables that likely have user-specific patterns
    const testTables = [
      'users', 'usermetadata', 'user_api_keys', 'user_activity_logs', 
      'user_referrals', 'user_sessions', 'keywordshub_tags', 
      'sitespren_tags', 'sitespren_tags_relations', 'api_keys_t3',
      'notification_settings', 'dynamic_user_settings'
    ];
    
    console.log('Testing accessibility of user-specific tables...\n');
    
    for (const tableName of testTables) {
      try {
        console.log('â”â”â” Analyzing: ' + tableName + ' â”â”â”');
        
        const { data: sample, error } = await supabase
          .from(tableName)
          .select('*')
          .limit(1);
        
        if (error) {
          console.log('âŒ Not accessible: ' + error.message.split('.')[0]);
          continue;
        }
        
        if (sample && sample.length > 0) {
          const columns = Object.keys(sample[0]);
          console.log('âœ… ACCESSIBLE - Structure (' + columns.length + ' columns):');
          
          // Look for user-related foreign keys
          const userColumns = columns.filter(col => 
            col.includes('user') || col.includes('fk_user') || col.includes('rel_user') || 
            col.includes('user_internal_id') || col === 'user_id'
          );
          
          const booleanColumns = columns.filter(col => 
            col.startsWith('is_') || col.includes('_flag') || col.includes('_status') ||
            col.includes('starred') || col.includes('flagged')
          );
          
          // Look for entity/organizational columns
          const entityColumns = columns.filter(col => 
            col.includes('starred') || col.includes('flagged') || col.includes('marked') ||
            col.includes('entity') || col.includes('category') || col.includes('type')
          );
          
          console.log('  ğŸ”‘ User FK columns: ' + (userColumns.length > 0 ? userColumns.join(', ') : 'None'));
          console.log('  ğŸš© Boolean columns: ' + (booleanColumns.length > 0 ? booleanColumns.join(', ') : 'None'));
          console.log('  ğŸ·ï¸  Entity columns: ' + (entityColumns.length > 0 ? entityColumns.join(', ') : 'None'));
          
          // Get record count
          const { count } = await supabase
            .from(tableName)
            .select('*', { count: 'exact', head: true });
          console.log('  ğŸ“Š Record count: ' + count);
          
          // If this looks like a user-specific organizational pattern, analyze it further
          if (userColumns.length > 0 && (booleanColumns.length > 0 || entityColumns.length > 0)) {
            console.log('  ğŸ¯ POTENTIAL PATTERN MATCH - Analyzing structure...');
            
            // Show sample record structure
            const sampleRecord = sample[0];
            console.log('  ğŸ“‹ Sample record structure:');
            Object.entries(sampleRecord).forEach(([key, value]) => {
              const type = value === null ? 'null' : typeof value;
              const displayValue = value === null ? 'NULL' : 
                                 type === 'string' && value.length > 30 ? value.substring(0, 30) + '...' : 
                                 String(value);
              console.log('    ' + key + ': ' + type + ' = ' + displayValue);
            });
          }
          
        } else {
          console.log('âš ï¸  Table exists but is empty');
        }
        
        console.log('');
        
      } catch (e) {
        console.log('âŒ Error: ' + e.message);
        console.log('');
      }
    }
    
  } catch (err) {
    console.error('ğŸ’¥ Error:', err.message);
  }
}

const { createClient } = require('@supabase/supabase-js');
const supabase = createClient(process.env.SUPABASE_URL, process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY);

async function analyzeSitesprenTagsPattern() {
  try {
    console.log('ğŸ¯ ANALYZING SITESPREN TAGS PATTERN - PERFECT MATCH FOR REDDJAR');
    console.log('============================================================');
    
    // Analyze sitespren_tags table structure
    console.log('ğŸ“‹ SITESPREN_TAGS TABLE ANALYSIS:');
    const { data: tagsData, error: tagsError } = await supabase
      .from('sitespren_tags')
      .select('*')
      .order('created_at', { ascending: false });
    
    if (tagsError) throw tagsError;
    
    if (tagsData && tagsData.length > 0) {
      console.log('âœ… Structure and sample data:');
      const columns = Object.keys(tagsData[0]);
      console.log('  Columns: ' + columns.join(', '));
      
      console.log('\n  ğŸ“Š Sample records:');
      tagsData.slice(0, 3).forEach((tag, i) => {
        console.log('  Record ' + (i+1) + ':');
        Object.entries(tag).forEach(([key, value]) => {
          const displayValue = value === null ? 'NULL' : 
                             typeof value === 'string' && value.length > 40 ? value.substring(0, 40) + '...' : 
                             String(value);
          console.log('    ' + key + ': ' + displayValue);
        });
        console.log('');
      });
    }
    
    // Analyze sitespren_tags_relations table structure
    console.log('\nğŸ“‹ SITESPREN_TAGS_RELATIONS TABLE ANALYSIS:');
    const { data: relationsData, error: relationsError } = await supabase
      .from('sitespren_tags_relations')
      .select('*')
      .order('created_at', { ascending: false });
    
    if (relationsError) throw relationsError;
    
    if (relationsData && relationsData.length > 0) {
      console.log('âœ… Structure and sample data:');
      const columns = Object.keys(relationsData[0]);
      console.log('  Columns: ' + columns.join(', '));
      
      console.log('\n  ğŸ“Š Sample records:');
      relationsData.slice(0, 5).forEach((relation, i) => {
        console.log('  Record ' + (i+1) + ':');
        Object.entries(relation).forEach(([key, value]) => {
          console.log('    ' + key + ': ' + value);
        });
        console.log('');
      });
      
      // Analyze the relationship pattern
      console.log('ğŸ”— RELATIONSHIP ANALYSIS:');
      const uniqueUsers = [...new Set(relationsData.map(r => r.fk_user_id))];
      const uniqueTags = [...new Set(relationsData.map(r => r.fk_tag_id))];
      const uniqueSitespren = [...new Set(relationsData.map(r => r.fk_sitespren_id))];
      
      console.log('  ğŸ‘¥ Unique users: ' + uniqueUsers.length + ' (' + uniqueUsers.join(', ') + ')');
      console.log('  ğŸ·ï¸  Unique tags: ' + uniqueTags.length + ' (' + uniqueTags.join(', ') + ')');
      console.log('  ğŸ“„ Unique sitespren records: ' + uniqueSitespren.length);
      
      // Show user-specific tag assignments
      console.log('\nğŸ“Š USER-SPECIFIC TAG ASSIGNMENTS:');
      uniqueUsers.forEach(userId => {
        const userRelations = relationsData.filter(r => r.fk_user_id === userId);
        console.log('  User ' + userId + ': ' + userRelations.length + ' tag assignments');
        
        // Group by sitespren_id to show multiple tags per item
        const sitesprenGroups = {};
        userRelations.forEach(rel => {
          if (!sitesprenGroups[rel.fk_sitespren_id]) {
            sitesprenGroups[rel.fk_sitespren_id] = [];
          }
          sitesprenGroups[rel.fk_sitespren_id].push(rel.fk_tag_id);
        });
        
        Object.entries(sitesprenGroups).slice(0, 3).forEach(([sitesprenId, tagIds]) => {
          console.log('    Sitespren ' + sitesprenId + ' -> Tags: [' + tagIds.join(', ') + ']');
        });
      });
    }
    
    // Test the join relationship
    console.log('\nğŸ”— TESTING JOIN RELATIONSHIPS:');
    const { data: joinTest, error: joinError } = await supabase
      .from('sitespren_tags_relations')
      .select(`
        fk_sitespren_id,
        fk_user_id,
        sitespren_tags:fk_tag_id(tag_name, tag_color),
        sitespren:fk_sitespren_id(sitespren_base, driggs_brand_name)
      `)
      .limit(3);
    
    if (!joinError && joinTest) {
      console.log('âœ… Join relationships working:');
      joinTest.forEach((join, i) => {
        console.log('  Example ' + (i+1) + ':');
        console.log('    User: ' + join.fk_user_id);
        console.log('    Sitespren: ' + (join.sitespren ? join.sitespren.sitespren_base + ' (' + join.sitespren.driggs_brand_name + ')' : 'NULL'));
        console.log('    Tag: ' + (join.sitespren_tags ? join.sitespren_tags.tag_name + ' (' + join.sitespren_tags.tag_color + ')' : 'NULL'));
        console.log('');
      });
    }
    
    console.log('ğŸ¯ PATTERN SUMMARY FOR REDDJAR APPLICATION:');
    console.log('==========================================');
    console.log('âœ… This is the EXACT pattern we need for reddjar user-specific entities!');
    console.log('');
    console.log('Key insights:');
    console.log('1. sitespren_tags = Entity types (like is_starred, is_flagged, is_squared)');
    console.log('2. sitespren_tags_relations = User-specific assignments (which user marked which item with which entity)');
    console.log('3. Three-way relationship: User + Target_Item + Entity_Type');
    console.log('4. Multiple entities per item per user possible');
    console.log('5. Completely user-specific - no global interference');

## **RESEARCH COMPLETE: User-Specific Organizational Entity System for Reddjar**

Based on my comprehensive research, I've found the perfect existing pattern in your system and designed the complete solution. Here's the analysis and proposal:

---

## **ğŸ” RESEARCH FINDINGS**

### **Current Reddjar System Analysis**
- **Global Star System**: Single `is_starred` boolean in `redditurlsvat` table
- **Current Usage**: 34 starred vs 16,866 unstarred records (0.2% utilization)
- **Limitation**: All users see the same star status (no user-specific organization)

### **Inspiration from XPagesManager1**
- **4 Organizational Entities**: `starred`, `flagged`, `penatgoned`, `circled`
- **Boolean Icon UI**: Each entity rendered as clickable icon with toggle functionality
- **Visual Design**: 30px width icons in grouped layout

### **Perfect Pattern Match Found: `sitespren_tags` System**
**This is your existing billing/management system with the exact structure we need:**

**Tables:**
- `sitespren_tags` (3 records) - Entity type definitions
- `sitespren_tags_relations` (40 records) - User-specific assignments
- **Pattern**: User + Target_Item + Entity_Type relationships

**Key Features:**
- âœ… User-specific entity assignments via `fk_user_id`
- âœ… Multiple entity types per user possible  
- âœ… No global interference between users
- âœ… Scalable many-to-many relationship design
- âœ… UUID-based foreign keys for data integrity

---

## **ğŸ—ï¸ PROPOSED SQL SCHEMA**

### **Table 1: `reddjar_entities` (Entity Type Definitions)**
```sql
CREATE TABLE reddjar_entities (
    entity_id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
    entity_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'starred', 'flagged', 'squared', 'circled', 'triangled'
    entity_icon VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'star', 'flag', 'square', 'circle', 'triangle'  
    entity_color VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'yellow', 'red', 'blue', 'green', 'purple'
    entity_order INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, -- UI display order (0-4)
    is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    UNIQUE(entity_name),
    UNIQUE(entity_order)
);

-- Insert the 5 organizational entities
INSERT INTO reddjar_entities (entity_name, entity_icon, entity_color, entity_order) VALUES
    ('starred', 'star', 'yellow', 0),
    ('flagged', 'flag', 'red', 1),
    ('squared', 'square', 'blue', 2),
    ('circled', 'circle', 'green', 3),
    ('triangled', 'triangle', 'purple', 4);
```

### **Table 2: `reddjar_user_entities` (User-Specific Assignments)**
```sql
CREATE TABLE reddjar_user_entities (
    relation_id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
    fk_reddit_url_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES redditurlsvat(url_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    fk_entity_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES reddjar_entities(entity_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    fk_user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    entity_position INTEGER DEFAULT 0, -- For future ordering within entity type
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Prevent duplicate assignments (one entity per user per URL)
    UNIQUE(fk_reddit_url_id, fk_entity_id, fk_user_id)
);

-- Indexes for performance
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_entities_user_id ON reddjar_user_entities(fk_user_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_entities_url_id ON reddjar_user_entities(fk_reddit_url_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_entities_entity_id ON reddjar_user_entities(fk_entity_id);
```

```

â”‚

```

## **ğŸ”Œ PROPOSED API ENDPOINTS**

### **GET `/api/reddjar-user-entities`**
```typescript
// Fetch user's entity assignments for display in table
GET /api/reddjar-user-entities?user_internal_id=UUID&url_id=123

Response: {
  url_id: 123,
  entities: [
    { entity_name: 'starred', entity_icon: 'star', entity_color: 'yellow', assigned: true },
    { entity_name: 'flagged', entity_icon: 'flag', entity_color: 'red', assigned: false },
    // ... for all 5 entities
  ]
}
```

### **POST `/api/reddjar-user-entities/toggle`**
```typescript
// Toggle entity assignment for user
POST /api/reddjar-user-entities/toggle
Body: {
  user_internal_id: "UUID",
  url_id: 123,
  entity_name: "starred"
}

Response: { assigned: true, message: "Entity toggled successfully" }
```

### **GET `/api/reddjar-user-entities/bulk`**
```typescript
// Get entity states for multiple URLs (for table rendering)
GET /api/reddjar-user-entities/bulk?user_internal_id=UUID&url_ids=123,124,125

Response: {
  "123": { starred: true, flagged: false, squared: true, circled: false, triangled: false },
  "124": { starred: false, flagged: true, squared: false, circled: false, triangled: false },
  "125": { starred: false, flagged: false, squared: false, circled: true, triangled: false }
}
```

### **UserEntityIcon Component**
```typescript
// New component for rendering user-specific entity icons
interface UserEntityIconProps {
  urlId: number;
  entityName: string;
  entityIcon: string;
  entityColor: string;
  assigned: boolean;
  onToggle: (urlId: number, entityName: string) => void;
}

function UserEntityIcon({ urlId, entityName, entityIcon, entityColor, assigned, onToggle }) {
  return (
    <button
      onClick={() => onToggle(urlId, entityName)}
      className={`w-6 h-6 flex items-center justify-center rounded ${
        assigned 
          ? `text-${entityColor}-600 bg-${entityColor}-100` 
          : 'text-gray-300 hover:text-gray-500'
      }`}
    >
      <IconComponent name={entityIcon} />
    </button>
  );
}
```

     6â†’import { useAuth } from '@/app/context/AuthContext';
     7â†’import BensaFieldTable from '@/app/(protected3)/bensa/components/BensaFieldTable';
     8â†’import { bensaUtgsConfig } from '@/app/(protected3)/bensa/config/bensaUtgsConfig';
     9â†’import { bensaZarnosConfig } from '@/app/(protected3)/bensa/config/bensaZarnosConfig';
    10â†’import { bensaXpagesConfig } from '@/app/(protected3)/bensa/config/bensaXpagesConfig';
    11â†’import { bensaUsersConfig } from '@/app/(protected3)/bensa/config/bensaUsersConfig';
    12â†’
    13â†’interface XPage {
    14â†’  xpage_id: number;
    15â†’  title1: string | null;
    16â†’  main_url: string | null;
    17â†’  meta_title: string | null;
    18â†’  title2: string | null;
    19â†’  desc1: string | null;
    20â†’  caption: string | null;
    21â†’  pagepath_url: string | null;
    22â†’  pagepath_long: string | null;
    23â†’  pagepath_short: string | null;
    24â†’  position_marker: number | null;
    25â†’  show_in_all_pages_nav_area1: boolean | null;
    26â†’  broad_parent_container: string | null;
    27â†’  has_mutation_observer: string | null;
    28â†’  created_at: string;
    29â†’  updated_at: string;
    30â†’}
    31â†’
    32â†’interface UTG {
    33â†’  utg_id: string;
    34â†’  utg_name: string;
    35â†’  rel_xpage_id: number | null;
    36â†’}
    37â†’
    38â†’interface Zarno {
    39â†’  zarno_id: number;
    40â†’  fk_xpage_id: number | null;
    41â†’  zarno_name: string | null;
    42â†’  zarno_type: string | null;
    43â†’  zarno_path: string | null;
    44â†’  zarno_status: string | null;
    45â†’  zarno_config: any;
    46â†’  execution_order: number | null;
    47â†’  dependencies: any;
    48â†’  metadata: any;
    49â†’  is_enabled: boolean;
    50â†’  created_at: string;
    51â†’  updated_at: string;
    52â†’  created_by: string | null;
    53â†’}
    54â†’
    55â†’interface ZarnoDropdownItem {
    56â†’  zarno_id: number;
    57â†’  zarno_name: string | null;
    58â†’  fk_xpage_id: number | null;
    59â†’}
    60â†’
    61â†’interface User {
    62â†’  id: string;
    63â†’  email: string | null;
    64â†’  is_admin: boolean | null;
    65â†’  sidebar_menu_active: boolean | null;
    66â†’  ruplin_api_key_1: string | null;
    67â†’  background_processing_settings: any;
    68â†’  created_at: string;
    69â†’  auth_id: string;
    70â†’}
    71â†’
    72â†’export default function MyHubClient() {
    73â†’  const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState<'general' | 'billing' | 'settings'>('general');
    74â†’  const [xpages, setXpages] = useState<XPage[]>([]);
    75â†’  const [utgs, setUtgs] = useState<UTG[]>([]);
    76â†’  const [zarnos, setZarnos] = useState<ZarnoDropdownItem[]>([]);
    77â†’  const [users, setUsers] = useState<User[]>([]);
    78â†’  const [selectedXpage, setSelectedXpage] = useState<XPage | null>(null);
    79â†’  const [selectedXpageId, setSelectedXpageId] = useState<number | null>(null);
    80â†’  const [selectedUtgId, setSelectedUtgId] = useState<string | null>(null);
    81â†’  const [selectedUtgRecord, setSelectedUtgRecord] = useState<any | null>(null);
    82â†’  const [selectedZarnoId, setSelectedZarnoId] = useState<number | null>(null);
    83â†’  const [selectedZarnoRecord, setSelectedZarnoRecord] = useState<Zarno | null>(null);
    84â†’  const [selectedUserId, setSelectedUserId] = useState<string | null>(null);
    85â†’  const [selectedUserRecord, setSelectedUserRecord] = useState<User | null>(null);
    86â†’  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
    87â†’  const [loadingUtgs, setLoadingUtgs] = useState(false);
    88â†’  const [loadingZarnos, setLoadingZarnos] = useState(false);
    89â†’  const [showTooltip, setShowTooltip] = useState(false);
    90â†’  const [selectedFields, setSelectedFields] = useState<Set<string>>(new Set());
    91â†’  const [editingField, setEditingField] = useState<string | null>(null);
    92â†’  const [editingValue, setEditingValue] = useState<string>('');
    93â†’  const [fieldMetadata, setFieldMetadata] = useState<{[key: string]: {starred: boolean, flagged: boolean}}>({});
    94â†’  const [sortBy, setSortBy] = useState<string>('starred');
    95â†’  const [sortDirection, setSortDirection] = useState<'asc' | 'desc'>('asc');
    96â†’  const [boxEditorOpen, setBoxEditorOpen] = useState(false);
    97â†’  const [boxEditorValue, setBoxEditorValue] = useState('');
    98â†’  const [boxEditorField, setBoxEditorField] = useState<string>('');
    99â†’  const [boxEditorRecord, setBoxEditorRecord] = useState<any>(null);
   100â†’  const [boxEditorUpdateHandler, setBoxEditorUpdateHandler] = useState<((field: string, value: any) => Promise<void>) | null>(null);
   101â†’  const [currentUser, setCurrentUser] = useState<User | null>(null);
   102â†’  const [isCurrentUserAdmin, setIsCurrentUserAdmin] = useState(false);
   103â†’  
   104â†’  const router = useRouter();
   105â†’  const searchParams = useSearchParams();
   106â†’  const supabase = createClientComponentClient();
   107â†’  const { user } = useAuth();
   108â†’
   109â†’  // Initialize page - only run once
   110â†’  useEffect(() => {
   111â†’    fetchXpages();
   112â†’    fetchUsers();
   113â†’    fetchFieldMetadata();
   114â†’  }, []);
   115â†’
   116â†’  // Handle URL parameters - only when searchParams change
   117â†’  useEffect(() => {
   118â†’    if (!searchParams) return;
   119â†’    
   120â†’    // Get tab from URL if present
   121â†’    const tabParam = searchParams.get('tab');
   122â†’    if (tabParam && (tabParam === 'general' || tabParam === 'billing' || tabParam === 'settings')) {
   123â†’      setActiveTab(tabParam as 'general' | 'billing' | 'settings');
   124â†’    }
   125â†’    
   126â†’    // Get xpage_id from URL if present
   127â†’    const xpageIdParam = searchParams.get('xpage_id');
   128â†’    if (xpageIdParam) {
   129â†’      const xpageId = parseInt(xpageIdParam);
   130â†’      setSelectedXpageId(xpageId);
   131â†’      fetchSelectedXpage(xpageId);
   132â†’    }
   133â†’    
   134â†’    // Get utg_id from URL if present
   135â†’    const utgIdParam = searchParams.get('utg_id');
   136â†’    if (utgIdParam) {
   137â†’      setSelectedUtgId(utgIdParam);
   138â†’      fetchSelectedUtg(utgIdParam);
   139â†’    }
   140â†’    
   141â†’    // Get zarno_id from URL if present
   142â†’    const zarnoIdParam = searchParams.get('zarno_id');
   143â†’    if (zarnoIdParam) {
   144â†’      const zarnoId = parseInt(zarnoIdParam);
   145â†’      setSelectedZarnoId(zarnoId);
   146â†’      fetchSelectedZarno(zarnoId);
   147â†’    }
   148â†’  }, [searchParams]);
   149â†’
   150â†’  // Fetch UTGs when xpage is selected
   151â†’  useEffect(() => {
   152â†’    if (selectedXpageId) {
   153â†’      fetchRelatedUtgs(selectedXpageId);
   154â†’    } else {
   155â†’      setUtgs([]);
   156â†’      setSelectedUtgId(null);
   157â†’      setSelectedUtgRecord(null);
   158â†’    }
   159â†’  }, [selectedXpageId]);
   160â†’
   161â†’  // Fetch Zarnos when xpage is selected
   162â†’  useEffect(() => {
   163â†’    if (selectedXpageId) {
   164â†’      fetchRelatedZarnos(selectedXpageId);
   165â†’    } else {
   166â†’      setZarnos([]);
   167â†’      setSelectedZarnoId(null);
   168â†’      setSelectedZarnoRecord(null);
   169â†’    }
   170â†’  }, [selectedXpageId]);
   171â†’
   172â†’  const fetchXpages = async () => {
   173â†’    try {
   174â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   175â†’        .from('xpages')
   176â†’        .select('*')
   177â†’        .order('xpage_id', { ascending: true });
   178â†’
   179â†’      if (error) {
   180â†’        console.error('Error fetching xpages:', error);
   181â†’        return;
   182â†’      }
   183â†’
   184â†’      setXpages(data || []);
   185â†’    } catch (error) {
   186â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   187â†’    } finally {
   188â†’      setLoading(false);
   189â†’    }
   190â†’  };
   191â†’
   192â†’  const fetchSelectedXpage = async (xpageId: number) => {
   193â†’    try {
   194â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   195â†’        .from('xpages')
   196â†’        .select('*')
   197â†’        .eq('xpage_id', xpageId)
   198â†’        .single();
   199â†’
   200â†’      if (error) {
   201â†’        console.error('Error fetching selected xpage:', error);
   202â†’        return;
   203â†’      }
   204â†’
   205â†’      setSelectedXpage(data);
   206â†’    } catch (error) {
   207â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   208â†’    }
   209â†’  };
   210â†’
   211â†’  const fetchUsers = async () => {
   212â†’    try {
   213â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   214â†’        .from('users')
   215â†’        .select('*')
   216â†’        .order('email', { ascending: true });
   217â†’
   218â†’      if (error) {
   219â†’        console.error('Error fetching users:', error);
   220â†’        return;
   221â†’      }
   222â†’
   223â†’      setUsers(data || []);
   224â†’      
   225â†’      // Find current user and set admin status
   226â†’      if (user?.id) {
   227â†’        const currentUserRecord = data?.find(u => u.auth_id === user.id);
   228â†’        if (currentUserRecord) {
   229â†’          setCurrentUser(currentUserRecord);
   230â†’          setIsCurrentUserAdmin(currentUserRecord.is_admin || false);
   231â†’          // Auto-select current user if no user is selected
   232â†’          if (!selectedUserId) {
   233â†’            setSelectedUserId(currentUserRecord.id);
   234â†’            setSelectedUserRecord(currentUserRecord);
   235â†’          }
   236â†’        }
   237â†’      }
   238â†’    } catch (error) {
   239â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   240â†’    }
   241â†’  };
   242â†’
   243â†’  const fetchSelectedUser = async (userId: string) => {
   244â†’    try {
   245â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   246â†’        .from('users')
   247â†’        .select('*')
   248â†’        .eq('id', userId)
   249â†’        .single();
   250â†’
   251â†’      if (error) {
   252â†’        console.error('Error fetching selected user:', error);
   253â†’        return;
   254â†’      }
   255â†’
   256â†’      setSelectedUserRecord(data);
   257â†’    } catch (error) {
   258â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   259â†’    }
   260â†’  };
   261â†’
   262â†’  const fetchSelectedUtg = async (utgId: string) => {
   263â†’    try {
   264â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   265â†’        .from('utgs')
   266â†’        .select('*')
   267â†’        .eq('utg_id', utgId)
   268â†’        .single();
   269â†’
   270â†’      if (error) {
   271â†’        console.error('Error fetching selected utg:', error);
   272â†’        return;
   273â†’      }
   274â†’
   275â†’      setSelectedUtgRecord(data);
   276â†’    } catch (error) {
   277â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   278â†’    }
   279â†’  };
   280â†’
   281â†’  const fetchFieldMetadata = async () => {
   282â†’    try {
   283â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   284â†’        .from('frenzi_field_metadata')
   285â†’        .select('field_name, starred, flagged')
   286â†’        .eq('table_name', 'xpages');
   287â†’
   288â†’      if (error) {
   289â†’        console.error('Error fetching field metadata:', error);
   290â†’        return;
   291â†’      }
   292â†’
   293â†’      const metadataMap: {[key: string]: {starred: boolean, flagged: boolean}} = {};
   294â†’      data?.forEach(item => {
   295â†’        metadataMap[item.field_name] = {
   296â†’          starred: item.starred || false,
   297â†’          flagged: item.flagged || false
   298â†’        };
   299â†’      });
   300â†’      setFieldMetadata(metadataMap);
   301â†’    } catch (error) {
   302â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   303â†’    }
   304â†’  };
   305â†’
   306â†’  const fetchRelatedUtgs = async (xpageId: number) => {
   307â†’    try {
   308â†’      setLoadingUtgs(true);
   309â†’      
   310â†’      // Fetch UTGs where rel_xpage_id matches the selected xpage_id
   311â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   312â†’        .from('utgs')
   313â†’        .select('utg_id, utg_name, rel_xpage_id')
   314â†’        .eq('rel_xpage_id', xpageId)
   315â†’        .order('utg_name', { ascending: true });
   316â†’
   317â†’      if (error) {
   318â†’        console.error('Error fetching UTGs:', error);
   319â†’        return;
   320â†’      }
   321â†’
   322â†’      setUtgs(data || []);
   323â†’      
   324â†’      // Auto-select if only one UTG available (only if no UTG is currently selected)
   325â†’      if (data && data.length === 1 && !selectedUtgId) {
   326â†’        const singleUtg = data[0];
   327â†’        setSelectedUtgId(singleUtg.utg_id);
   328â†’        fetchSelectedUtg(singleUtg.utg_id);
   329â†’      }
   330â†’    } catch (error) {
   331â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   332â†’    } finally {
   333â†’      setLoadingUtgs(false);
   334â†’    }
   335â†’  };
   336â†’
   337â†’  const fetchSelectedZarno = async (zarnoId: number) => {
   338â†’    try {
   339â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   340â†’        .from('zarnos')
   341â†’        .select('*')
   342â†’        .eq('zarno_id', zarnoId)
   343â†’        .single();
   344â†’
   345â†’      if (error) {
   346â†’        console.error('Error fetching selected zarno:', error);
   347â†’        return;
   348â†’      }
   349â†’
   350â†’      setSelectedZarnoRecord(data);
   351â†’    } catch (error) {
   352â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   353â†’    }
   354â†’  };
   355â†’
   356â†’  const fetchRelatedZarnos = async (xpageId: number) => {
   357â†’    try {
   358â†’      setLoadingZarnos(true);
   359â†’      
   360â†’      // Fetch Zarnos where fk_xpage_id matches the selected xpage_id
   361â†’      const { data, error } = await supabase
   362â†’        .from('zarnos')
   363â†’        .select('zarno_id, zarno_name, fk_xpage_id')
   364â†’        .eq('fk_xpage_id', xpageId)
   365â†’        .order('zarno_name', { ascending: true });
   366â†’
   367â†’      if (error) {
   368â†’        console.error('Error fetching Zarnos:', error);
   369â†’        return;
   370â†’      }
   371â†’
   372â†’      setZarnos(data || []);
   373â†’      
   374â†’      // Auto-select if only one Zarno available (only if no Zarno is currently selected)
   375â†’      if (data && data.length === 1 && !selectedZarnoId) {
   376â†’        const singleZarno = data[0];
   377â†’        setSelectedZarnoId(singleZarno.zarno_id);
   378â†’        fetchSelectedZarno(singleZarno.zarno_id);
   379â†’      }
   380â†’    } catch (error) {
   381â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   382â†’    } finally {
   383â†’      setLoadingZarnos(false);
   384â†’    }
   385â†’  };
   386â†’
   387â†’  const updateURLWithCurrentState = (updates: {
   388â†’    tab?: 'general' | 'billing' | 'settings';
   389â†’    xpage_id?: number;
   390â†’    utg_id?: string;
   391â†’    zarno_id?: number;
   392â†’  }) => {
   393â†’    const params = new URLSearchParams(searchParams || '');
   394â†’    
   395â†’    // Update or set tab
   396â†’    if (updates.tab) {
   397â†’      params.set('tab', updates.tab);
   398â†’    }
   399â†’    
   400â†’    // Update or set xpage_id
   401â†’    if (updates.xpage_id !== undefined) {
   402â†’      params.set('xpage_id', updates.xpage_id.toString());
   403â†’    }
   404â†’    
   405â†’    // Update or set utg_id
   406â†’    if (updates.utg_id !== undefined) {
   407â†’      if (updates.utg_id) {
   408â†’        params.set('utg_id', updates.utg_id);
   409â†’      } else {
   410â†’        params.delete('utg_id');
   411â†’      }
   412â†’    }
   413â†’    
   414â†’    // Update or set zarno_id
   415â†’    if (updates.zarno_id !== undefined) {
   416â†’      if (updates.zarno_id) {
   417â†’        params.set('zarno_id', updates.zarno_id.toString());
   418â†’      } else {
   419â†’        params.delete('zarno_id');
   420â†’      }
   421â†’    }
   422â†’    
   423â†’    router.push(`/myhub?${params.toString()}`);
   424â†’  };
   425â†’
   426â†’  const handleXpageChange = (xpageId: number) => {
   427â†’    setSelectedXpageId(xpageId);
   428â†’    fetchSelectedXpage(xpageId);
   429â†’    // Reset selected UTG and Zarno when XPage changes
   430â†’    setSelectedUtgId(null);
   431â†’    setSelectedUtgRecord(null);
   432â†’    setSelectedZarnoId(null);
   433â†’    setSelectedZarnoRecord(null);
   434â†’    
   435â†’    updateURLWithCurrentState({ xpage_id: xpageId, utg_id: '', zarno_id: 0 });
   436â†’    
   437â†’    // Fetch related entities after URL update (which will auto-select if only one option)
   438â†’    setTimeout(() => {
   439â†’      fetchRelatedUtgs(xpageId);
   440â†’      fetchRelatedZarnos(xpageId);
   441â†’    }, 100);
   442â†’  };
   443â†’
   444â†’  const handleUtgChange = (utgId: string) => {
   445â†’    setSelectedUtgId(utgId);
   446â†’    if (utgId) {
   447â†’      fetchSelectedUtg(utgId);
   448â†’    } else {
   449â†’      setSelectedUtgRecord(null);
   450â†’    }
   451â†’    updateURLWithCurrentState({ utg_id: utgId });
   452â†’  };
   453â†’
   454â†’  const handleUserChange = (userId: string) => {
   455â†’    // Security check: non-admin users can only select themselves
   456â†’    if (!isCurrentUserAdmin && currentUser) {
   457â†’      const selectedUser = users.find(u => u.id === userId);
   458â†’      if (selectedUser && selectedUser.auth_id !== currentUser.auth_id) {
   459â†’        alert('You can only access your own user record.');
   460â†’        return;
   461â†’      }
   462â†’    }
   463â†’    
   464â†’    setSelectedUserId(userId);
   465â†’    if (userId) {
   466â†’      fetchSelectedUser(userId);
   467â†’    } else {
   468â†’      setSelectedUserRecord(null);
   469â†’    }
   470â†’  };
   471â†’
   472â†’  const handleZarnoChange = (zarnoId: number) => {
   473â†’    const validZarnoId = zarnoId > 0 ? zarnoId : null;
   474â†’    setSelectedZarnoId(validZarnoId);
   475â†’    if (validZarnoId) {
   476â†’      fetchSelectedZarno(validZarnoId);
   477â†’    } else {
   478â†’      setSelectedZarnoRecord(null);
   479â†’    }
   480â†’    updateURLWithCurrentState({ zarno_id: validZarnoId || 0 });
   481â†’  };
   482â†’
   483â†’  const copyTooltipText = () => {
   484â†’    const text = 'All rows from utgs where rel_xpage_id matches xpages.xpage_id';
   485â†’    navigator.clipboard.writeText(text);
   486â†’  };
   487â†’
   488â†’  // Define field properties for xpages table
   489â†’  const xpageFields = [
   490â†’    { key: 'xpage_id', type: 'integer', editable: false },
   491â†’    { key: 'title1', type: 'text', editable: true },
   492â†’    { key: 'main_url', type: 'text', editable: true },
   493â†’    { key: 'meta_title', type: 'text', editable: true },
   494â†’    { key: 'title2', type: 'text', editable: true },
   495â†’    { key: 'desc1', type: 'text', editable: true },
   496â†’    { key: 'caption', type: 'text', editable: true },
   497â†’    { key: 'pagepath_url', type: 'text', editable: true },
   498â†’    { key: 'pagepath_long', type: 'text', editable: true },
   499â†’    { key: 'pagepath_short', type: 'text', editable: true },
   500â†’    { key: 'position_marker', type: 'integer', editable: true },
   501â†’    { key: 'show_in_all_pages_nav_area1', type: 'boolean', editable: true },
   502â†’    { key: 'broad_parent_container', type: 'text', editable: true },
   503â†’    { key: 'urlparam_total_keys_listed', type: 'jsonb', editable: true },
   504â†’    { key: 'created_at', type: 'timestamp', editable: false },
   505â†’    { key: 'updated_at', type: 'timestamp', editable: false }
   506â†’  ];
   507â†’
   508â†’  const updateXpageField = async (field: string, value: any) => {
   509â†’    if (!selectedXpageId) return;
   510â†’
   511â†’    try {
   512â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   513â†’        .from('xpages')
   514â†’        .update({ [field]: value })
   515â†’        .eq('xpage_id', selectedXpageId);
   516â†’
   517â†’      if (error) {
   518â†’        console.error('Error updating field:', error);
   519â†’        return;
   520â†’      }
   521â†’
   522â†’      // Update local state
   523â†’      setSelectedXpage((prev: XPage | null) => prev ? { ...prev, [field]: value } : null);
   524â†’    } catch (error) {
   525â†’      console.error('Error updating field:', error);
   526â†’    }
   527â†’  };
   528â†’
   529â†’  const updateUserField = async (field: string, value: any) => {
   530â†’    if (!selectedUserId) return;
   531â†’
   532â†’    // Security check: non-admin users can only edit their own records
   533â†’    if (!isCurrentUserAdmin && selectedUserRecord && selectedUserRecord.auth_id !== currentUser?.auth_id) {
   534â†’      alert('You can only edit your own user record.');
   535â†’      return;
   536â†’    }
   537â†’
   538â†’    // Additional security check: only admins can edit admin-only fields
   539â†’    const adminOnlyFields = ['is_admin', 'ruplin_api_key_1', 'background_processing_settings'];
   540â†’    if (adminOnlyFields.includes(field) && !isCurrentUserAdmin) {
   541â†’      alert('Only administrators can edit this field.');
   542â†’      return;
   543â†’    }
   544â†’
   545â†’    try {
   546â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   547â†’        .from('users')
   548â†’        .update({ [field]: value })
   549â†’        .eq('id', selectedUserId);
   550â†’
   551â†’      if (error) {
   552â†’        console.error('Error updating user field:', error);
   553â†’        return;
   554â†’      }
   555â†’
   556â†’      // Update local state
   557â†’      setSelectedUserRecord((prev: User | null) => prev ? { ...prev, [field]: value } : null);
   558â†’      
   559â†’      // If updating current user, also update the currentUser state
   560â†’      if (selectedUserRecord && selectedUserRecord.auth_id === currentUser?.auth_id) {
   561â†’        setCurrentUser((prev: User | null) => prev ? { ...prev, [field]: value } : null);
   562â†’        
   563â†’        // Update admin status if is_admin was changed
   564â†’        if (field === 'is_admin') {
   565â†’          setIsCurrentUserAdmin(value);
   566â†’        }
   567â†’      }
   568â†’    } catch (error) {
   569â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   570â†’    }
   571â†’  };
   572â†’
   573â†’  const handleFieldClick = (field: string, currentValue: any) => {
   574â†’    const fieldConfig = xpageFields.find(f => f.key === field);
   575â†’    if (!fieldConfig?.editable) return;
   576â†’
   577â†’    setEditingField(field);
   578â†’    setEditingValue(currentValue?.toString() || '');
   579â†’  };
   580â†’
   581â†’  const handleFieldSave = async () => {
   582â†’    if (!editingField) return;
   583â†’
   584â†’    const fieldConfig = xpageFields.find(f => f.key === editingField);
   585â†’    let processedValue: any = editingValue;
   586â†’
   587â†’    if (fieldConfig?.type === 'integer') {
   588â†’      processedValue = editingValue === '' ? null : parseInt(editingValue);
   589â†’      if (isNaN(processedValue)) processedValue = null;
   590â†’    } else if (fieldConfig?.type === 'boolean') {
   591â†’      processedValue = editingValue === 'true';
   592â†’    } else if (editingValue === '') {
   593â†’      processedValue = null;
   594â†’    }
   595â†’
   596â†’    await updateXpageField(editingField, processedValue);
   597â†’    setEditingField(null);
   598â†’    setEditingValue('');
   599â†’  };
   600â†’
   601â†’  const handleFieldCancel = () => {
   602â†’    setEditingField(null);
   603â†’    setEditingValue('');
   604â†’  };
   605â†’
   606â†’  const handleBooleanToggle = async (field: string, currentValue: boolean | null) => {
   607â†’    const newValue = currentValue === null ? true : !currentValue;
   608â†’    await updateXpageField(field, newValue);
   609â†’  };
   610â†’
   611â†’  const handleFieldCheckboxChange = (field: string, checked: boolean) => {
   612â†’    const newSelected = new Set(selectedFields);
   613â†’    if (checked) {
   614â†’      newSelected.add(field);
   615â†’    } else {
   616â†’      newSelected.delete(field);
   617â†’    }
   618â†’    setSelectedFields(newSelected);
   619â†’  };
   620â†’
   621â†’  const handleSelectAllFields = (checked: boolean) => {
   622â†’    if (checked) {
   623â†’      setSelectedFields(new Set(xpageFields.map(f => f.key)));
   624â†’    } else {
   625â†’      setSelectedFields(new Set());
   626â†’    }
   627â†’  };
   628â†’
   629â†’  const handleUtgUpdate = async (field: string, value: any) => {
   630â†’    if (!selectedUtgId) return;
   631â†’
   632â†’    try {
   633â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   634â†’        .from('utgs')
   635â†’        .update({ [field]: value })
   636â†’        .eq('utg_id', selectedUtgId);
   637â†’
   638â†’      if (error) {
   639â†’        console.error('Error updating utg field:', error);
   640â†’        return;
   641â†’      }
   642â†’
   643â†’      // Update local state
   644â†’      setSelectedUtgRecord((prev: any) => prev ? { ...prev, [field]: value } : null);
   645â†’    } catch (error) {
   646â†’      console.error('Error updating utg field:', error);
   647â†’    }
   648â†’  };
   649â†’
   650â†’  const handleZarnoUpdate = async (field: string, value: any) => {
   651â†’    if (!selectedZarnoId) return;
   652â†’
   653â†’    try {
   654â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   655â†’        .from('zarnos')
   656â†’        .update({ [field]: value })
   657â†’        .eq('zarno_id', selectedZarnoId);
   658â†’
   659â†’      if (error) {
   660â†’        console.error('Error updating zarno field:', error);
   661â†’        return;
   662â†’      }
   663â†’
   664â†’      // Update local state
   665â†’      setSelectedZarnoRecord((prev: Zarno | null) => prev ? { ...prev, [field]: value } : null);
   666â†’    } catch (error) {
   667â†’      console.error('Error updating zarno field:', error);
   668â†’    }
   669â†’  };
   670â†’
   671â†’  const handleBoxEditorOpen = (field: string, value: string, record: any, updateHandler: (field: string, value: any) => Promise<void>) => {
   672â†’    setBoxEditorField(field);
   673â†’    setBoxEditorValue(value || '');
   674â†’    setBoxEditorRecord(record);
   675â†’    setBoxEditorUpdateHandler(() => updateHandler);
   676â†’    setBoxEditorOpen(true);
   677â†’  };
   678â†’
   679â†’  const handleBoxEditorSave = async () => {
   680â†’    if (boxEditorUpdateHandler) {
   681â†’      await boxEditorUpdateHandler(boxEditorField, boxEditorValue);
   682â†’    }
   683â†’    setBoxEditorOpen(false);
   684â†’  };
   685â†’
   686â†’  const handleBoxEditorClose = () => {
   687â†’    setBoxEditorOpen(false);
   688â†’  };
   689â†’
   690â†’  const toggleFieldStar = async (fieldName: string) => {
   691â†’    const currentStarred = fieldMetadata[fieldName]?.starred || false;
   692â†’    const newStarred = !currentStarred;
   693â†’
   694â†’    try {
   695â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   696â†’        .from('frenzi_field_metadata')
   697â†’        .upsert({
   698â†’          table_name: 'xpages',
   699â†’          field_name: fieldName,
   700â†’          starred: newStarred,
   701â†’          flagged: fieldMetadata[fieldName]?.flagged || false
   702â†’        }, {
   703â†’          onConflict: 'table_name,field_name'
   704â†’        });
   705â†’
   706â†’      if (error) {
   707â†’        console.error('Error updating field star:', error);
   708â†’        return;
   709â†’      }
   710â†’
   711â†’      // Update local state
   712â†’      setFieldMetadata(prev => ({
   713â†’        ...prev,
   714â†’        [fieldName]: {
   715â†’          starred: newStarred,
   716â†’          flagged: prev[fieldName]?.flagged || false
   717â†’        }
   718â†’      }));
   719â†’    } catch (error) {
   720â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   721â†’    }
   722â†’  };
   723â†’
   724â†’  const toggleFieldFlag = async (fieldName: string) => {
   725â†’    const currentFlagged = fieldMetadata[fieldName]?.flagged || false;
   726â†’    const newFlagged = !currentFlagged;
   727â†’
   728â†’    try {
   729â†’      const { error } = await supabase
   730â†’        .from('frenzi_field_metadata')
   731â†’        .upsert({
   732â†’          table_name: 'xpages',
   733â†’          field_name: fieldName,
   734â†’          starred: fieldMetadata[fieldName]?.starred || false,
   735â†’          flagged: newFlagged
   736â†’        }, {
   737â†’          onConflict: 'table_name,field_name'
   738â†’        });
   739â†’
   740â†’      if (error) {
   741â†’        console.error('Error updating field flag:', error);
   742â†’        return;
   743â†’      }
   744â†’
   745â†’      // Update local state
   746â†’      setFieldMetadata(prev => ({
   747â†’        ...prev,
   748â†’        [fieldName]: {
   749â†’          starred: prev[fieldName]?.starred || false,
   750â†’          flagged: newFlagged
   751â†’        }
   752â†’      }));
   753â†’    } catch (error) {
   754â†’      console.error('Error:', error);
   755â†’    }
   756â†’  };
   757â†’
   758â†’  // Handle column header click for sorting
   759â†’  const handleSort = (column: string) => {
   760â†’    if (sortBy === column) {
   761â†’      setSortDirection(sortDirection === 'asc' ? 'desc' : 'asc');
   762â†’    } else {
   763â†’      setSortBy(column);
   764â†’      setSortDirection('asc');
   765â†’    }
   766â†’  };
   767â†’
   768â†’  // Sort fields based on selected sort option
   769â†’  const getSortedFields = () => {
   770â†’    const fieldsWithMetadata = xpageFields.map(field => ({
   771â†’      ...field,
   772â†’      starred: fieldMetadata[field.key]?.starred || false,
   773â†’      flagged: fieldMetadata[field.key]?.flagged || false,
   774â†’      value: selectedXpage ? selectedXpage[field.key as keyof XPage] : null
   775â†’    }));
   776â†’
   777â†’    return fieldsWithMetadata.sort((a, b) => {
   778â†’      let compareResult = 0;
   779â†’
   780â†’      switch (sortBy) {
   781â†’        case 'starred':
   782â†’          compareResult = (b.starred ? 1 : 0) - (a.starred ? 1 : 0);
   783â†’          break;
   784â†’        case 'flagged':
   785â†’          compareResult = (b.flagged ? 1 : 0) - (a.flagged ? 1 : 0);
   786â†’          break;
   787â†’        case 'field_name':
   788â†’          compareResult = a.key.localeCompare(b.key);
   789â†’          break;
   790â†’        case 'value':
   791â†’          const aVal = a.value?.toString() || '';
   792â†’          const bVal = b.value?.toString() || '';
   793â†’          compareResult = aVal.localeCompare(bVal);
   794â†’          break;
   795â†’        default:
   796â†’          compareResult = 0;
   797â†’      }
   798â†’
   799â†’      return sortDirection === 'asc' ? compareResult : -compareResult;
   800â†’    });
   801â†’  };
   802â†’
   803â†’  const dropdownContainerStyle = {
   804â†’    marginBottom: '20px',
   805â†’    display: 'flex',
   806â†’    alignItems: 'center',
   807â†’    gap: '10px'
   808â†’  };
   809â†’
   810â†’  const labelStyle = {
   811â†’    fontSize: '14px',
   812â†’    fontWeight: '600'
   813â†’  };
   814â†’
   815â†’  const selectStyle = {
   816â†’    padding: '8px 12px',
   817â†’    fontSize: '14px',
   818â†’    border: '1px solid #ccc',
   819â†’    borderRadius: '4px',
   820â†’    backgroundColor: '#fff',
   821â†’    minWidth: '300px',
   822â†’    cursor: 'pointer'
   823â†’  };
   824â†’
   825â†’  const disabledSelectStyle = {
   826â†’    ...selectStyle,
   827â†’    backgroundColor: '#f5f5f5',
   828â†’    cursor: 'not-allowed',
   829â†’    opacity: 0.6
   830â†’  };
   831â†’
   832â†’  const tooltipContainerStyle = {
   833â†’    position: 'relative' as const,
   834â†’    display: 'inline-flex',
   835â†’    alignItems: 'center',
   836â†’    gap: '5px'
   837â†’  };
   838â†’
   839â†’  const tooltipIconStyle = {
   840â†’    cursor: 'help',
   841â†’    fontSize: '16px',
   842â†’    color: '#666'
   843â†’  };
   844â†’
   845â†’  const tooltipBoxStyle = {
   846â†’    position: 'absolute' as const,
   847â†’    top: '100%',
   848â†’    left: '0',
   849â†’    marginTop: '5px',
   850â†’    padding: '10px',
   851â†’    backgroundColor: '#333',
   852â†’    color: '#fff',
   853â†’    borderRadius: '4px',
   854â†’    fontSize: '12px',
   855â†’    whiteSpace: 'nowrap' as const,
   856â†’    zIndex: 1000,
   857â†’    display: showTooltip ? 'flex' : 'none',
   858â†’    alignItems: 'center',
   859â†’    gap: '10px',
   860â†’    boxShadow: '0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.2)'
   861â†’  };
   862â†’
   863â†’  const copyButtonStyle = {
   864â†’    padding: '2px 8px',
   865â†’    backgroundColor: '#555',
   866â†’    border: 'none',
   867â†’    borderRadius: '3px',
   868â†’    color: '#fff',
   869â†’    fontSize: '11px',
   870â†’    cursor: 'pointer'
   871â†’  };
   872â†’
   873â†’  const tabContainerStyle = {
   874â†’    width: '100%',
   875â†’    marginBottom: '20px'
   876â†’  };
   877â†’
   878â†’  const tabListStyle = {
   879â†’    display: 'flex',
   880â†’    width: '100%',
   881â†’    margin: '0',
   882â†’    padding: '0',
   883â†’    listStyle: 'none'
   884â†’  };
   885â†’
   886â†’  const tabStyle = {
   887â†’    flex: '1',
   888â†’    textAlign: 'center' as const,
   889â†’    padding: '12px 16px',
   890â†’    cursor: 'pointer',
   891â†’    borderTop: '2px solid #a4a4a4',
   892â†’    borderLeft: '2px solid #a4a4a4',
   893â†’    borderRight: '2px solid #a4a4a4',
   894â†’    borderBottom: '2px solid #ba5816',
   895â†’    backgroundColor: '#f8f9fa',
   896â†’    fontSize: '20px',
   897â†’    fontWeight: '500'
   898â†’  };
   899â†’
   900â†’  const activeTabStyle = {
   901â†’    ...tabStyle,
   902â†’    backgroundColor: '#fff',
   903â†’    borderBottom: '2px solid #fff',
   904â†’    borderTop: '2px solid #ba5816',
   905â†’    borderLeft: '2px solid #ba5816',
   906â†’    borderRight: '2px solid #ba5816',
   907â†’    fontWeight: 'bold'
   908â†’  };
   909â†’
   910â†’  const contentStyle = {
   911â†’    padding: '20px',
   912â†’    minHeight: '400px'
   913â†’  };
   914â†’
   915â†’  // Function to get appropriate tab style based on active tab and position
   916â†’  const getTabStyle = (tabName: 'general' | 'billing' | 'settings') => {
   917â†’    if (tabName === activeTab) {
   918â†’      return activeTabStyle;
   919â†’    }
   920â†’    
   921â†’    // For inactive tabs, handle border collision with active tab and adjacent tabs
   922â†’    let style = { ...tabStyle };
   923â†’    
   924â†’    // Remove right border if this tab is to the left of active tab
   925â†’    if ((tabName === 'general' && activeTab === 'billing') || 
   926â†’        (tabName === 'billing' && activeTab === 'settings')) {
   927â†’      style.borderRight = 'none';
   928â†’    }
   929â†’    
   930â†’    // Remove left border if this tab is to the right of active tab
   931â†’    if ((tabName === 'billing' && activeTab === 'general') || 
   932â†’        (tabName === 'settings' && activeTab === 'billing')) {
   933â†’      style.borderLeft = 'none';
   934â†’    }
   935â†’    
   936â†’    // Handle border doubling between adjacent inactive tabs
   937â†’    // Remove right border from left tab in inactive pairs
   938â†’    if (tabName === 'general' && activeTab === 'settings') {
   939â†’      // general and billing are both inactive, remove right border from general
   940â†’      style.borderRight = 'none';
   941â†’    } else if (tabName === 'billing' && activeTab === 'general') {
   942â†’      // billing and settings are both inactive, remove right border from billing
   943â†’      style.borderRight = 'none';
   944â†’    }
   945â†’    
   946â†’    return style;
   947â†’  };
   948â†’
   949â†’  return (
   950â†’    <div>
   951â†’      <h1 style={{ fontSize: '24px', marginBottom: '20px' }}>
   952â†’        <span style={{ fontWeight: 'bold' }}>MyHub Account Settings</span>
   953â†’      </h1>
   954â†’
   955â†’      <div style={dropdownContainerStyle}>
   956â†’        <label style={labelStyle}>Select users:</label>
   957â†’        <select 
   958â†’          style={selectStyle}
   959â†’          value={selectedUserId || ''}
   960â†’          onChange={(e) => handleUserChange(e.target.value)}
   961â†’          disabled={loading}
   962â†’        >
   963â†’          <option value="">-- Select a User --</option>
   964â†’          {users.map((user) => (
   965â†’            <option 
   966â†’              key={user.id} 
   967â†’              value={user.id}
   968â†’              disabled={!isCurrentUserAdmin && user.auth_id !== currentUser?.auth_id}
   969â†’            >
   970â†’              {user.id} - {user.email || '(No email)'} - {user.auth_id === currentUser?.auth_id ? 'CurrentlyLoggedInAccount' : '-'}
   971â†’            </option>
   972â†’          ))}
   973â†’        </select>
   974â†’        
   975â†’        <label style={labelStyle}>empty (waiting):</label>
   976â†’        <select 
   977â†’          style={{...selectStyle, opacity: 0.5, cursor: 'not-allowed'}}
   978â†’          disabled={true}
   979â†’        >
   980â†’          <option value="">-- Coming Soon --</option>
   981â†’        </select>
   982â†’        
   983â†’        <label style={labelStyle}>empty (waiting):</label>
   984â†’        <select 
   985â†’          style={{...selectStyle, opacity: 0.5, cursor: 'not-allowed'}}
   986â†’          disabled={true}
   987â†’        >
   988â†’          <option value="">-- Coming Soon --</option>
   989â†’        </select>
   990â†’
   991â†’        <div style={tooltipContainerStyle}>
   992â†’          <span 
   993â†’            style={tooltipIconStyle}
   994â†’            onMouseEnter={() => setShowTooltip(true)}
   995â†’            onMouseLeave={() => setShowTooltip(false)}
   996â†’          >
   997â†’            â„¹ï¸
   998â†’          </span>
   999â†’        </div>
  1000â†’      </div>
  1001â†’
  1002â†’      <div style={tabContainerStyle}>
  1003â†’        <ul style={tabListStyle}>
  1004â†’          <li 
  1005â†’            style={getTabStyle('general')}
  1006â†’            onClick={() => {
  1007â†’              setActiveTab('general');
  1008â†’              updateURLWithCurrentState({ tab: 'general' });
  1009â†’            }}
  1010â†’          >
  1011â†’            {activeTab === 'general' ? 
  1012â†’              <span style={{ color: 'red', marginRight: '14px' }}>â˜…</span> : 
  1013â†’              <span style={{ color: 'black', marginRight: '14px' }}>â€¢</span>
  1014â†’            }
  1015â†’            general
  1016â†’          </li>
  1017â†’          <li 
  1018â†’            style={getTabStyle('billing')}
  1019â†’            onClick={() => {
  1020â†’              setActiveTab('billing');
  1021â†’              updateURLWithCurrentState({ tab: 'billing' });
  1022â†’            }}
  1023â†’          >
  1024â†’            {activeTab === 'billing' ? 
  1025â†’              <span style={{ color: 'red', marginRight: '14px' }}>â˜…</span> : 
  1026â†’              <span style={{ color: 'black', marginRight: '14px' }}>â€¢</span>
  1027â†’            }
  1028â†’            billing
  1029â†’          </li>
  1030â†’          <li 
  1031â†’            style={getTabStyle('settings')}
  1032â†’            onClick={() => {
  1033â†’              setActiveTab('settings');
  1034â†’              updateURLWithCurrentState({ tab: 'settings' });
  1035â†’            }}
  1036â†’          >
  1037â†’            {activeTab === 'settings' ? 
  1038â†’              <span style={{ color: 'red', marginRight: '14px' }}>â˜…</span> : 
  1039â†’              <span style={{ color: 'black', marginRight: '14px' }}>â€¢</span>
  1040â†’            }
  1041â†’            settings
  1042â†’          </li>
  1043â†’        </ul>
  1044â†’      </div>
  1045â†’
  1046â†’      <div style={contentStyle}>
  1047â†’        {!selectedUserId ? (
  1048â†’          <div style={{ textAlign: 'center', color: '#666', marginTop: '50px' }}>
  1049â†’            <p>Please select a User from the dropdown above to manage account settings.</p>
  1050â†’          </div>
  1051â†’        ) : (
  1052â†’          <>
  1053â†’            {activeTab === 'general' && (
  1054â†’              <div>

async function analyzeFrenziFieldMetadata() {

- Uses table_name + field_name composite key
- Boolean entities: starred, flagged (extensible design)
- Global scope (no user-specific segregation in this table)

## **ğŸ¯ CORRECTED ANALYSIS: /MYHUB BILLING SYSTEM PATTERN**

You're absolutely right! I was looking at the wrong system. Here's the correct analysis of the **actual billing system** at `/myhub`:

---

## **ğŸ” /MYHUB BILLING SYSTEM ANALYSIS**

### **Page Structure: `/myhub/pclient.tsx`**
- **Tabs**: `general`, `billing`, `settings` (billing tab currently shows "Coming Soon")
- **Core Tables**: `users`, `xpages`, `utgs`, `zarnos` 
- **Field-Level Metadata System**: Uses `frenzi_field_metadata` table
- **User-Specific Access Control**: Admin vs non-admin permissions

### **Key Database Table: `frenzi_field_metadata`**
```sql
-- ACTUAL STRUCTURE FROM YOUR BILLING SYSTEM:
CREATE TABLE frenzi_field_metadata (
    table_name VARCHAR NOT NULL,           -- 'users', 'xpages', 'utgs', 'zarnos'
    field_name VARCHAR NOT NULL,           -- 'email', 'title1', 'utg_name', etc.
    starred BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- â­ Entity type 1
    flagged BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- ğŸš© Entity type 2
    priority INTEGER DEFAULT 0,            -- Sorting/ordering
    notes TEXT,                           -- Additional metadata
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
    chain_of_custody_desc TEXT,           -- Audit trail
    
    PRIMARY KEY (table_name, field_name)  -- Composite key!
);
```

### **Current Data in `frenzi_field_metadata`:**
- **60 records** across 4 tables (`users`, `xpages`, `utgs`, `zarnos`)
- **23 starred fields**, **1 flagged field**
- **Field-level organizational entities** (not record-level)
- **Global scope** (no user-specific segregation)

---

## **âš¡ CRITICAL DIFFERENCE FROM MY ORIGINAL PROPOSAL**

| **Aspect** | **My Original Proposal** | **Your /myhub Billing System** |
|------------|-------------------------|--------------------------------|
| **Granularity** | Record-level entities | **Field-level entities** |
| **Scope** | User-specific assignments | **Global field metadata** |
| **Primary Key** | User + Record + Entity | **Table + Field** |
| **Purpose** | "Which user starred this URL?" | **"Which fields are important?"** |
| **UI Location** | Table rows (per record) | **Column headers/field management** |

---

## **ğŸ”§ REVISED SQL SCHEMA - HYBRID APPROACH**

Based on your `/myhub` pattern, here are **two alternative approaches**:

### **Option A: Field-Level Entities (Pure /myhub Pattern)**
```sql
-- Following your frenzi_field_metadata pattern exactly
CREATE TABLE reddjar_field_metadata (
    table_name VARCHAR NOT NULL DEFAULT 'redditurlsvat',
    field_name VARCHAR NOT NULL,           -- 'url_datum', 'subreddit_name', etc.
    starred BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- â­ Important field
    flagged BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- ğŸš© Problematic field  
    squared BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- â¬œ Custom entity 3
    circled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- â­• Custom entity 4
    triangled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,       -- ğŸ”º Custom entity 5
    priority INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    chain_of_custody_desc TEXT,
    
    PRIMARY KEY (table_name, field_name)
);

-- Usage: Mark which FIELDS are important, not which RECORDS
-- UI: Icons in column headers, not in table rows
```

### **Option B: Dual-Level System (Hybrid)**
```sql
-- 1. Field-level metadata (like /myhub)
CREATE TABLE reddjar_field_metadata (
    table_name VARCHAR NOT NULL DEFAULT 'redditurlsvat',
    field_name VARCHAR NOT NULL,
    starred BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    flagged BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
    priority INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    notes TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    PRIMARY KEY (table_name, field_name)
);

-- 2. Record-level user entities (like my original proposal)
CREATE TABLE reddjar_record_entities (
    relation_id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
    fk_reddit_url_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES redditurlsvat(url_id),
    fk_user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id),
    starred BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- User-specific record star
    flagged BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- User-specific record flag
    squared BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- User-specific record square
    circled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,         -- User-specific record circle
    triangled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,       -- User-specific record triangle
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    UNIQUE(fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id)
);
```

---

## **ğŸ“Š RELATIONSHIP DIAGRAMS**

### **Option A: Field-Level Only (Pure /myhub Pattern)**
```
redditurlsvat (existing)
â”œâ”€â”€ url_id, url_datum, subreddit_name, post_title, etc.
â”œâ”€â”€ is_starred (KEEP - Global record star)
â”‚
reddjar_field_metadata (new - field-level entities)
â”œâ”€â”€ table_name='redditurlsvat' 
â”œâ”€â”€ field_name âˆˆ ['url_datum', 'subreddit_name', 'post_title', ...]
â”œâ”€â”€ starred, flagged, squared, circled, triangled
â”‚
UI Impact:
â”œâ”€â”€ Column headers have entity icons
â”œâ”€â”€ Sorting/filtering by field importance
â”œâ”€â”€ No per-user, per-record entities
```

### **Option B: Dual-Level System (Hybrid)**
```
users (existing)
â”œâ”€â”€ id (UUID) â† fk_user_id
â”‚
redditurlsvat (existing)  
â”œâ”€â”€ url_id (INTEGER) â† fk_reddit_url_id
â”œâ”€â”€ is_starred (BOOLEAN) [KEEP - Global record star]
â”‚
reddjar_field_metadata (new - field importance)
â”œâ”€â”€ table_name + field_name (composite PK)
â”œâ”€â”€ starred, flagged (which fields matter)
â”‚
reddjar_record_entities (new - user-specific record entities)
â”œâ”€â”€ fk_reddit_url_id â†’ redditurlsvat.url_id
â”œâ”€â”€ fk_user_id â†’ users.id  
â”œâ”€â”€ starred, flagged, squared, circled, triangled
â”‚
UI Impact:
â”œâ”€â”€ Column headers: Field-level entity icons
â”œâ”€â”€ Table rows: User-specific record entity icons (5 columns)
â”œâ”€â”€ Dual organization system: Field + Record levels
```

## **ğŸ¤” RECOMMENDATION QUESTION**

Based on your `/myhub` pattern analysis, I need to understand your preference:

**Which approach matches your vision?**

1. **Field-Level Entities** (Pure `/myhub` style)
   - Mark which **columns/fields** are important
   - UI shows entity icons in **column headers**
   - Global scope (no user-specific assignments)

2. **Record-Level Entities** (My original proposal)
   - Mark which **individual URLs** are important per user
   - UI shows entity icons in **table rows** (5 new columns)
   - User-specific scope (each user has own assignments)

3. **Dual-Level System** (Hybrid)
   - Both field-level AND record-level entities
   - Column headers AND row-level entity icons
   - More complex but covers both use cases

The `/myhub` system uses **Option 1** (field-level), but your original request mentioned **5 new UI columns** which suggests **Option 2** (record-level). 

**Which direction should I design for the final schema and implementation plan?**

Perfect! Now I understand the **SaaS product architecture**. This is a **shared data + private metadata** system. Let me design the optimal database structure for this use case:

## **ğŸ¯ SAAS PRODUCT REQUIREMENTS ANALYSIS**

### **Business Model:**
- **Shared Dataset**: Millions of Reddit URLs visible to all users
- **Private Metadata**: Each user can personally organize the same shared data
- **99% Public Data**: Most rows have `user_id = NULL` (public/shared)
- **1% Private Data**: Some rows belong to specific users
- **5 Personal Entities**: starred, flagged, squared, circled, triangled per user

---

## **ğŸ—ï¸ OPTIMAL DATABASE ARCHITECTURE**

### **Core Tables Structure:**

```sql
-- 1. MAIN DATA TABLE (existing, with small addition)
ALTER TABLE redditurlsvat 
ADD COLUMN user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL;
-- This remains NULL for 99% of shared public data

-- 2. USER-SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONAL METADATA (new)
CREATE TABLE reddjar_user_metadata (
    metadata_id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
    fk_reddit_url_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES redditurlsvat(url_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    fk_user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    
    -- The 5 organizational entities
    is_starred BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,      -- â­ User's private star
    is_flagged BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,      -- ğŸš© User's private flag  
    is_squared BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,      -- â¬œ User's private square
    is_circled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,      -- â­• User's private circle
    is_triangled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,    -- ğŸ”º User's private triangle
    
    -- Metadata
    notes TEXT,                            -- User's private notes on this URL
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW(),
    
    -- Ensure one metadata record per user per URL
    UNIQUE(fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id)
);

-- Performance indexes for SaaS scale
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_user_id ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_url_id ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_reddit_url_id);
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_starred ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, is_starred) WHERE is_starred = true;
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_flagged ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, is_flagged) WHERE is_flagged = true;
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_squared ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, is_squared) WHERE is_squared = true;
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_circled ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, is_circled) WHERE is_circled = true;
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_triangled ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, is_triangled) WHERE is_triangled = true;
```

---

## **ğŸ“Š RELATIONSHIP DIAGRAM**

```
users (existing)
â”œâ”€â”€ id (UUID) â† fk_user_id
â”‚
redditurlsvat (existing + 1 new column)  
â”œâ”€â”€ url_id (INTEGER, PK) â† fk_reddit_url_id
â”œâ”€â”€ url_datum, subreddit_name, post_title, etc.
â”œâ”€â”€ is_starred (BOOLEAN) [GLOBAL - everyone sees same value]
â”œâ”€â”€ user_id (UUID, NULLABLE) [NEW - NULL for 99% of shared data]
â”‚
reddjar_user_metadata (new - user-specific entities)
â”œâ”€â”€ fk_reddit_url_id â†’ redditurlsvat.url_id
â”œâ”€â”€ fk_user_id â†’ users.id  
â”œâ”€â”€ is_starred, is_flagged, is_squared, is_circled, is_triangled
â”œâ”€â”€ notes (private user notes)
â”‚
Data Distribution:
â”œâ”€â”€ redditurlsvat: ~10M rows (99% with user_id=NULL, 1% with user_id)
â”œâ”€â”€ reddjar_user_metadata: ~100K-1M rows (sparse, only when users interact)
```

---

## **âš¡ SCALABILITY & PERFORMANCE STRATEGY**

### **1. Sparse Metadata Pattern**
- **Only create metadata records when users interact**
- **No preemptive records** for all user/URL combinations
- **Millions of URLs Ã— thousands of users = manageable metadata table**

### **2. Efficient Queries**
```sql
-- Get user's view of URLs with their personal metadata
SELECT 
    r.url_id,
    r.url_datum,
    r.subreddit_name,
    r.is_starred as global_starred,  -- Global star (everyone sees)
    um.is_starred as user_starred,   -- User's private star
    um.is_flagged as user_flagged,   -- User's private flag
    um.is_squared as user_squared,   -- User's private square
    um.is_circled as user_circled,   -- User's private circle
    um.is_triangled as user_triangled, -- User's private triangle
    um.notes as user_notes
FROM redditurlsvat r
LEFT JOIN reddjar_user_metadata um ON (r.url_id = um.fk_reddit_url_id AND um.fk_user_id = $1)
WHERE r.user_id IS NULL OR r.user_id = $1  -- Show public data + user's private data
ORDER BY r.created_at DESC
LIMIT 50;
```

### **3. Bulk Operations API**
```typescript
// Get metadata states for multiple URLs (for table rendering)
GET /api/reddjar-user-metadata/bulk?user_id=UUID&url_ids=1,2,3,4,5

Response: {
  "1": { starred: true, flagged: false, squared: false, circled: true, triangled: false },
  "2": { starred: false, flagged: true, squared: false, circled: false, triangled: false },
  "3": null,  // No user metadata exists
  "4": { starred: false, flagged: false, squared: true, circled: false, triangled: false },
  "5": null   // No user metadata exists
}
```

## **ğŸ”Œ API ENDPOINTS**

### **Toggle Entity**
```typescript
POST /api/reddjar-user-metadata/toggle
Body: {
  user_id: "UUID",
  url_id: 123,
  entity: "starred" | "flagged" | "squared" | "circled" | "triangled"
}

-- SQL Logic:
INSERT INTO reddjar_user_metadata (fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id, is_starred)
VALUES ($url_id, $user_id, true)
ON CONFLICT (fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id) 
DO UPDATE SET is_starred = NOT reddjar_user_metadata.is_starred;
```

### **Get User's Filtered View**
```typescript
GET /api/reddjar?user_id=UUID&filter=starred&page=1&limit=50
-- Returns URLs where user has starred them
```

## **ğŸ’¾ STORAGE EFFICIENCY**

### **Space Analysis:**
- **10M URLs in redditurlsvat**: ~99% have `user_id = NULL`
- **1,000 active users**: Each might interact with ~100 URLs on average
- **reddjar_user_metadata**: ~100K records (very manageable)
- **Each metadata record**: ~50 bytes (UUID + 5 booleans + timestamps)
- **Total metadata storage**: ~5MB (incredibly efficient!)

### **Query Performance:**
- **Indexed lookups** on user_id for fast personal views
- **Partial indexes** on entity flags for filtered views
- **LEFT JOIN** pattern keeps queries fast even with millions of URLs

_**Agent (claude-sonnet-4-20250514)**_

## **ğŸ” ANALYSIS: PRIVATE USER URLs IMPACT**

Yes, this **significantly changes** the database architecture! Here's why:

---

## **ğŸ“Š REVISED DATA DISTRIBUTION:**

**Original Understanding:**
- 99% public URLs (user_id = NULL)
- 1% user-specific URLs

**New Reality:**
- ~98% public URLs (user_id = NULL, is_private_url = FALSE) 
- ~1% user-private URLs (user_id = UUID, is_private_url = TRUE)
- ~1% user-contributed public URLs (user_id = UUID, is_private_url = FALSE)

---

## **ğŸ—ï¸ UPDATED DATABASE SCHEMA:**

### **Modified redditurlsvat table:**
```sql
-- redditurlsvat (existing + 2 new fields)
â”œâ”€â”€ url_id                    (INTEGER, PK)
â”œâ”€â”€ url_datum, subreddit_name, etc... (existing fields)
â”œâ”€â”€ is_starred                (BOOLEAN, existing - GLOBAL star)
â”œâ”€â”€ user_id                   (UUID, NEW - FK to users.id, nullable)
â”œâ”€â”€ is_private_url            (BOOLEAN, NEW - default FALSE)
â”œâ”€â”€ created_by_user_id        (UUID, NEW - FK to users.id, nullable)
â””â”€â”€ [existing fields...]
```

### **Query Logic Changes:**
```sql
-- User's view: Public URLs + Their Private URLs
SELECT * FROM redditurlsvat 
WHERE (is_private_url = FALSE)           -- All public URLs
   OR (is_private_url = TRUE AND user_id = $current_user_id)  -- Their private URLs

-- vs Original (simpler):
-- WHERE user_id IS NULL OR user_id = $current_user_id
```

---

## **ğŸ” PRIVACY & ACCESS CONTROL IMPLICATIONS:**

### **URL Visibility Matrix:**
| URL Type | user_id | is_private_url | Visible To |
|----------|---------|----------------|------------|
| System Public | NULL | FALSE | Everyone |
| User Public Contribution | UUID | FALSE | Everyone |  
| User Private | UUID | TRUE | Owner Only |

### **Business Logic Changes:**
- **Private URLs**: Never appear in other users' views
- **User Contributions**: Can become public if they pass validation
- **Ownership Tracking**: Need to track who added what URLs

---

## **âš¡ PERFORMANCE CONSIDERATIONS:**

### **Index Strategy:**
```sql
-- Critical for privacy filtering
CREATE INDEX idx_redditurlsvat_privacy 
ON redditurlsvat(is_private_url, user_id);

-- For user's personal view
CREATE INDEX idx_redditurlsvat_user_private 
ON redditurlsvat(user_id) WHERE is_private_url = TRUE;
```

### **Row-Level Security (RLS) Option:**
```sql
-- PostgreSQL RLS for automatic privacy enforcement
CREATE POLICY reddjar_privacy_policy ON redditurlsvat
FOR SELECT USING (
  is_private_url = FALSE 
  OR (is_private_url = TRUE AND user_id = current_user_id())
);
```

---

## **ğŸ¯ ARCHITECTURE DECISION POINTS:**

1. **Separate Tables vs Single Table?**
   - **Single Table** (current proposal): Simpler, better for analytics
   - **Separate Tables**: Could split public/private for performance

2. **Privacy Enforcement Level?**
   - **Application Level**: Queries must always include privacy filters
   - **Database Level**: Row-Level Security policies
   - **API Level**: Middleware ensures proper filtering

3. **URL Deduplication Strategy?**
   - What if User A adds private URL, then User B adds same URL publicly?
   - Should private URLs be promoted to public automatically?

---

## **ğŸš¨ CRITICAL IMPLICATIONS:**

### **Query Complexity Increase:**
- Every query must include privacy filtering
- Potential for accidental data leaks if filter forgotten
- More complex pagination and counting

### **Storage Efficiency:**
- Still very efficient - just additional boolean + UUID columns
- Privacy filtering indexes needed for performance

### **SaaS Model Impact:**
- Users can expand the dataset with private URLs
- Need clear policies on private â†’ public promotion
- Potential for users to "hoard" valuable URLs privately

**This is a significant architecture consideration that affects every query and UI component!** ğŸ¯

## **ğŸ—„ï¸ SUPABASE SQL IMPLEMENTATION**

### **Step 1: Modify Existing `redditurlsvat` Table**
```sql
-- Add new columns to existing redditurlsvat table
ALTER TABLE redditurlsvat 
ADD COLUMN user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL;

ALTER TABLE redditurlsvat 
ADD COLUMN is_private_url BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE NOT NULL;

ALTER TABLE redditurlsvat 
ADD COLUMN created_by_user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE SET NULL;

-- Add comments for documentation
COMMENT ON COLUMN redditurlsvat.user_id IS 'Owner of URL if private, or contributor if public. NULL for system URLs.';
COMMENT ON COLUMN redditurlsvat.is_private_url IS 'TRUE if URL is private to user_id, FALSE if publicly viewable';
COMMENT ON COLUMN redditurlsvat.created_by_user_id IS 'User who originally added this URL to the system';
```

### **Step 2: Create User Metadata Table**
```sql
-- Create the user-specific organizational metadata table
CREATE TABLE reddjar_user_metadata (
    metadata_id UUID DEFAULT gen_random_uuid() PRIMARY KEY,
    fk_reddit_url_id INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES redditurlsvat(url_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    fk_user_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES users(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    
    -- The 5 user-specific organizational entities
    is_starred BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE NOT NULL,
    is_flagged BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE NOT NULL,
    is_squared BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE NOT NULL,
    is_circled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE NOT NULL,
    is_triangled BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE NOT NULL,
    
    -- Additional user metadata
    notes TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW() NOT NULL,
    updated_at TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NOW() NOT NULL,
    
    -- Ensure one metadata record per user per URL
    UNIQUE(fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id)
);

-- Add comments
COMMENT ON TABLE reddjar_user_metadata IS 'User-specific organizational entities for Reddit URLs';
COMMENT ON COLUMN reddjar_user_metadata.is_starred IS 'User private star (separate from global redditurlsvat.is_starred)';
COMMENT ON COLUMN reddjar_user_metadata.is_flagged IS 'User private flag entity';
COMMENT ON COLUMN reddjar_user_metadata.is_squared IS 'User private square entity';
COMMENT ON COLUMN reddjar_user_metadata.is_circled IS 'User private circle entity';
COMMENT ON COLUMN reddjar_user_metadata.is_triangled IS 'User private triangle entity';
COMMENT ON COLUMN reddjar_user_metadata.notes IS 'User private notes about this URL';
```

### **Step 3: Create Performance Indexes**
```sql
-- Indexes for redditurlsvat privacy filtering
CREATE INDEX idx_redditurlsvat_privacy 
ON redditurlsvat(is_private_url, user_id);

CREATE INDEX idx_redditurlsvat_user_private 
ON redditurlsvat(user_id) 
WHERE is_private_url = TRUE;

CREATE INDEX idx_redditurlsvat_public 
ON redditurlsvat(created_at DESC) 
WHERE is_private_url = FALSE;

-- Indexes for reddjar_user_metadata performance
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_user_id 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id);

CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_url_id 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_reddit_url_id);

-- Partial indexes for each entity type (only index TRUE values)
CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_starred 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, fk_reddit_url_id) 
WHERE is_starred = TRUE;

CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_flagged 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, fk_reddit_url_id) 
WHERE is_flagged = TRUE;

CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_squared 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, fk_reddit_url_id) 
WHERE is_squared = TRUE;

CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_circled 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, fk_reddit_url_id) 
WHERE is_circled = TRUE;

CREATE INDEX idx_reddjar_user_metadata_triangled 
ON reddjar_user_metadata(fk_user_id, fk_reddit_url_id) 
WHERE is_triangled = TRUE;
```

### **Step 4: Create Updated At Trigger**
```sql
-- Trigger function to automatically update updated_at timestamp
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column()
RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
BEGIN
    NEW.updated_at = NOW();
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$$ language 'plpgsql';

-- Apply trigger to reddjar_user_metadata
CREATE TRIGGER update_reddjar_user_metadata_updated_at 
    BEFORE UPDATE ON reddjar_user_metadata 
    FOR EACH ROW 
    EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
```

### **Step 5: Row Level Security (Optional but Recommended)**
```sql
-- Enable RLS on reddjar_user_metadata (users can only see their own metadata)
ALTER TABLE reddjar_user_metadata ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Policy: Users can only access their own metadata
CREATE POLICY reddjar_user_metadata_policy ON reddjar_user_metadata
FOR ALL USING (
    fk_user_id = auth.uid()
);

-- Enable RLS on redditurlsvat for privacy (optional - can handle in app logic instead)
-- ALTER TABLE redditurlsvat ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

-- Policy: Users can see public URLs + their own private URLs  
-- CREATE POLICY reddjar_privacy_policy ON redditurlsvat
-- FOR SELECT USING (
--     is_private_url = FALSE 
--     OR (is_private_url = TRUE AND user_id = auth.uid())
-- );
```

### **Step 6: Grant Permissions**
```sql
-- Grant permissions to authenticated users
GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE ON reddjar_user_metadata TO authenticated;
GRANT SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE ON redditurlsvat TO authenticated;
GRANT USAGE ON SEQUENCE reddjar_user_metadata_metadata_id_seq TO authenticated;
```

### **Step 7: Test Data Validation**
```sql
-- Test the new structure with sample data
INSERT INTO reddjar_user_metadata (fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id, is_starred, notes)
VALUES (1, 'a8febfdb-1fba-4f2a-b8ac-da4b4a2ddc64', TRUE, 'Test user metadata')
ON CONFLICT (fk_reddit_url_id, fk_user_id) 
DO UPDATE SET 
    is_starred = EXCLUDED.is_starred,
    notes = EXCLUDED.notes,
    updated_at = NOW();

-- Verify the setup
SELECT 
    r.url_id,
    r.url_datum,
    r.is_starred as global_starred,
    r.is_private_url,
    r.user_id,
    um.is_starred as user_starred,
    um.is_flagged as user_flagged
FROM redditurlsvat r
LEFT JOIN reddjar_user_metadata um ON r.url_id = um.fk_reddit_url_id
WHERE r.url_id = 1;
```

    for (const tableName of potentialTables) {
      try {
        const { data: sample, error } = await supabase
          .from(tableName)
          .select('*')
          .limit(1);
        
        if (error) {
          // Table doesn't exist or not accessible
          continue;
        }
        
        if (sample !== null) {
          const columns = Object.keys(sample[0] || {});
          
          // Look for user-specific organizational patterns
          const userColumns = columns.filter(col => 
            col.includes('user') || col.includes('fk_user') || col.includes('rel_user')
          );
          
          const entityColumns = columns.filter(col => 
            col.includes('starred') || col.includes('flagged') || col.includes('entity') ||
            col.includes('tag') || col.includes('bookmark') || col.includes('favorite')
          );
          
          const organizationalColumns = columns.filter(col =>
            col.startsWith('is_') || col.includes('metadata') || col.includes('priority') ||
            col.includes('notes') || col.includes('starred') || col.includes('flagged')
          );
          
          if (userColumns.length > 0 && (entityColumns.length > 0 || organizationalColumns.length > 0)) {
            // Get record count
            const { count } = await supabase
              .from(tableName)
              .select('*', { count: 'exact', head: true });
            
            foundSystems.push({
              tableName,
              columns,
              userColumns,
              entityColumns,
              organizationalColumns,
              recordCount: count,
              sampleData: sample[0] || null
            });
          }
        }
      } catch (e) {
        // Continue to next table
        continue;
      }
    }
    
    if (foundSystems.length > 0) {
      console.log('âœ… FOUND EXISTING USER-SPECIFIC ORGANIZATIONAL SYSTEMS:');
      console.log('=======================================================\n');

        console.log('ğŸ·ï¸  Entity columns: ' + system.entityColumns.join(', '));
        console.log('âš™ï¸  Organizational columns: ' + system.organizationalColumns.join(', '));
        
        if (system.sampleData) {
          console.log('ğŸ“„ Sample structure:');
          Object.entries(system.sampleData).slice(0, 8).forEach(([key, value]) => {
            const displayValue = value === null ? 'NULL' : 
                               typeof value === 'string' && value.length > 40 ? value.substring(0, 40) + '...' : 
                               String(value);
            console.log('  ' + key + ': ' + displayValue);
          });
        }
        console.log('');
      });

      console.log('ğŸ” PATTERN ANALYSIS:');
